attributes.action: Allow women of any age to have a full hysterectomy if it is medically indicated.
attributes.additional_details: PMDD is a severe and disabling condition affecting thousands of women in the UK.  Monthly symptoms are exhausting - physically, mentally and emotionally.  For some, symptoms are so severe that they contemplate (and sometimes carry out) suicide.  A hysterectomy and oophorectomy, followed by HRT treatment, can provide an immediate and permanent cure.  Women are being denied this treatment on non-medical grounds - e.g. possible future family planning/partner consent. Women's bodies are their own.
attributes.background: If a hysterectomy and oophorectomy would treat/cure a condition, Pre Menstrual Dysmorphic Disorder for example, then any woman should have access to that course of action unless there are any medical reasons for withholding the treatment.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for making decisions about medical care. 

You can find out how to complain about medical care here: 

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/health/nhs-and-social-care-complaints/nhs-complaints-who-is-your-complaint-against/nhs-hospital-complaints/
